column2: adjútor in tribulatiónibus qŭaĕ invenérunt nos nìmis. ^ Our God is our refuge and strength~
column3: a helper in troubles which have found us exceedingly.

column1: 3 ^ Proptèrea non timébimus dum turbábitur terra, et transferèntur montes in cor maris. ^ Therefore we will not fear, when the earth shall be troubled~
column2: and the mountains shall be removed into the heart of the sea.

column1: 4 ^ Sonavérunt et turbátaĕ sunt aqŭaĕ eórum~
column2: conturbáti sunt montes in fortitúdine ejus. ^ Their waters roared and were troubled~
column3: the mountains were troubled with his strength.

column2: sanctificávit tabernáculum suum Altìssimus. ^ The rushing of the river maketh the city of God joyful~
column3: the most High hath sanctified his own tabernacle.

column1: 6 ^ Deus in mèdio ejus, non commovébitur~
column2: adjuvábit eam Deus mane dilúculo. ^ God is in the midst thereof, it shall not be moved~
column3: God will help it in the morning early.

column1: 7 ^ Conturbátaĕ sunt gentes, et inclináta sunt regna~
column2: dèdit vocem suam, mota est terra. ^ Nations were troubled, and kingdoms were bowed down~
column3: he uttered his voice, the earth trembled.

column2: suscèptor noster Deus Jacóbis. ^ The Lord of armies is with us~
column3: the God of Jacob is our protector.

column1: 9 ^ Věníte et vǐdéte ópera Dòmini, qŭaĕ pósuit prodìgia super terram, ^ Come and behold ye the works of the Lord, what wonders he hath done upon earth,

10 ^ áŭferens bella usqŭe ad finem terraĕ. Arcum cònteret, et confrìnget arma, et scuta combúret igni. ^ making wars to cease even to the end of the earth. He shall destroy the bow, and break the weapons, and the shield he shall burn in the fire.
11 ^ Vacáte, et vǐdéte qŭóniam ego sum Deus~
column2: exaltábor in gèntibus, et exaltábor in terra. ^ Be still and see that I am God~
column3: I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.

column2: suscèptor noster Deus Jacóbis. ^ The Lord of armies is with us~
column3: the God of Jacob is our protector.
